big_picture_notes: Colossians follows the Pauline pattern: Salutation (1:1–2) → Thanksgiving/Prayer (1:3–14) → Doctrinal body (1:15–2:23) → Ethical body (3:1–4:6) → Closing (4:7–18). Literary center of gravity is the Christological Hymn (1:15–20). The letter combats syncretistic error by antithesis: Christ’s ‘fullness’ and sufficiency vs ‘empty deceit’ and elemental spirits (2:8, 20). Glue includes repeated ‘in him/through him’ anaphora, the rooted/built‑up motif (2:7) mirrored by ‘put off/put on’ (3:8–12), and a movement from ontology (who Christ is) to praxis (how believers live).

stories.story_title: Christ, the Head: Introduction, Prayer, and Supremacy
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) epistolary opening; end (2:5) completes the foundational confidence (‘order’ and ‘steadfastness’) before the 2:6 imperative pivot. Glue: thanksgiving/prayer reports framing the Christ Hymn (1:15–20) and repeated ‘in/through him’ emphasizing Christ’s centrality.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Salutation to Colossae; thanksgiving concludes with gospel’s fruit/growth among them. Devices: epistolary proem, parallelism (‘bearing fruit and growing’).
‘From the day we heard…’ intercessory request; ends with redemption/forgiveness. Devices: purpose‑clause chain, kingdom transfer metaphor.
‘He is the image…’ elevated hymn from creation to reconciliation; ends ‘making peace by the blood of his cross’. Devices: parallelism, titular escalation, balanced creation/new‑creation structure.
‘And you…’ shifts to audience; conditional perseverance closes appeal. Devices: contrast (alienated vs reconciled), conditional caveat.
Sufferings for their sake; steward of the mystery: Christ in you. Devices: paradox (rejoice in sufferings), stewardship motif, mystery revelation.
Hearts encouraged, knit in love; ends with joy at their order/steadfastness. Devices: treasure/knowledge language, military order imagery.

stories.story_title: The Fullness of Christ Against the False Philosophy
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (2:6) ‘Therefore… walk in him’ launches the polemical core; end (2:23) dismisses regulations as powerless. Glue: fullness/completeness in Christ (2:9–10) vs emptiness of philosophy, elemental spirits refrain (2:8, 20).

scenes.scene_name: Walk in Christ; Warning Against Philosophy
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Therefore→walk; rooted/built up; ‘in him you have been filled’. Devices: rooted/built metaphor, capture warning, sufficiency verdict.
Circumcision without hands; buried/raised; debt canceled; rulers disarmed. Devices: typology (rite vs reality), financial and triumphal metaphors.
Let none judge re: food/festival/Sabbath; hold fast to the Head. Devices: shadow vs substance contrast, body‑Head growth metaphor.
If you died with Christ, why submit? Self‑made religion is of no value. Devices: rhetorical question, ironic dismissal, a fortiori reasoning.

stories.story_title: Life in the New Realm: Ethical Commands
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (3:1) raised‑with‑Christ imperative pivots to praxis; end (4:6) closes general outward conduct before personal greetings. Glue: ‘put off’ vices/‘put on’ virtues anaphora, household code, and gratitude thread.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Seek/think above; hidden life now, appearing then. Devices: above/below antithesis, hidden‑life eschatology.
Put to death earthly sins; you have put off the old self. Devices: vice lists, wrath rationale, clothing‑off metaphor.
New self renewed; virtues listed; above all love binds all. Devices: clothing‑on metaphor, unity summary (3:11), love as bond.
Peace rule, word dwell, do all in Jesus’ name with thanks. Devices: ruling umpire metaphor, repeated thanksgiving inclusio.
Wives submit; husbands love and do not be harsh. Devices: reciprocal pairing, Lord‑framed duty.
Children obey; fathers nurture; slaves serve the Lord; masters act justly. Devices: reciprocal duties with theological motives/rewards.
Continue in prayer; walk in wisdom toward outsiders; gracious, salty speech. Devices: prayer vigilance with thanksgiving, seasoned‑speech metaphor.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (4:7) introduces messengers and transitions to personalia; end (4:18) autograph and benediction. Glue: names/greetings (prosopography) and chains inclusio (4:3; 4:18).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Tychicus and Onesimus will tell all; ‘one of you’. Devices: commendation formula, credibility emphasis.
Aristarchus, Mark, Jesus Justus, Epaphras, Luke, Demas greet. Devices: prosopography, communal solidarity.
Greet Laodicea/Nympha; letter exchange; fulfill your ministry. Devices: extra‑Colossian instruction, specific admonition.
‘I, Paul, write… Remember my chains. Grace be with you.’ Devices: autograph verification, pathos appeal, grace close.
